channel.title: Cronin on UX
channel.description: Recent content on Cronin on UX

item.title: Name of the work 2
item.description: When she reached the first hills of the Italic Mountains, she had a last view back on the skyline of her hometown Bookmarksgrove, the headline of Alphabet Village and the subline of her own road, the Line Lane.

item.title: Name of the work 3
item.description: Fifth abundantly made Give sixth hath. Cattle creature i be don’t them.

item.title: Item without image
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.

item.title: Evaluating Cooper's Goal Directed Design
item.description: Steve Jobs suggested that the key to successful software is user experience. He states (2011:01.53.04”) “One of the things that I have always found is, that, you have got to start with the customer experience and work backwards to the technology…we have tried to come up with a strategy and a vision for apple, it started with what incredible benefits can we give the customer, where can we take the customer”.

item.title: Virtual Teams and Swift Trust
item.description: Why Some Virtual Team Succeed Virtual teams have become an essential part IT work practices. Indeed the idea that a company or organization can develop global reach without developing some degree of virtual team structure is hard to imagine. Professor Charles Handy (writing in 1995) argued virtuality is an irresistible economic force. Handy wrote that virtual teams are built on trust - “Trust inevitably requires some sense of mutuality, of reciprocal loyalty”.

item.title: Name of the work 1
item.description: Even the all-powerful Pointing has no control about the blind texts it is an almost unorthographic life. One day however a small line of blind text by the name of Lorem Ipsum decided to leave for the far World of Grammar.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
